Literature Review: Electrochemical imaging of interfaces in energy storage via scanning probe methods has emerged as a crucial tool for understanding the complex dynamics of electrochemical energy storage systems (EESSs). The development of electrochemical scanning probe techniques (ESPTs) has enabled researchers to visualize interfacial processes in real-time, providing valuable insights into the chemical, electronic, and morphological changes that occur at interfaces. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of ESPTs, their operating principles, applications, and prospects for future advancements.
